results.name: Triangle read by rows. Main diagonal is positive. The rest of the terms are negative.
comment: Triangle can be used in matrix inverses. Signs in columns as in A153881.
Iff n is a triangular number, a(n)=1; otherwise, a(n)=-1. (This is explicitly implemented in the second Mathematica program below.) - _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 27 2014
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..30 of the triangle, flattened
mathematica: Flatten[Table[PadLeft[{1},n,-1],{n,15}]] (* or *) With[{tr=Accumulate[ Range[ 15]]}, Table[If[MemberQ[tr,n],1,-1],{n,Last[tr]}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 27 2014 *)
program: (Sage) flatten([[1 if k==n else -1 for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)]) # _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 06 2021
(Magma) [k eq n select 1 else -1: k in [1..n], n in [1..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 06 2021
